channel.title: How to un encrypt passwords on pi server exion?
channel.description: hey i need help un encrytping these passwords in the server. they are automatically encrypted with something called isaac random gen. if you can help it would be much appreciated! :)

item.title: How to un encrypt passwords on pi server exion?
item.dc:creator: @Dinoboy Dinoboy
item.description:
@Dinoboy wrote:

ok that’s a terrible method of encrypting.

first of all, you should hash not encrypt. second of all, you should use salts.

Also, personally, in my server, i hash passwords using a salt and the SHA-512 hashing algorithm, it has no collisions nor does SHA-384

Read full topic

item.source: How to un encrypt passwords on pi server exion?

item.title: How to un encrypt passwords on pi server exion?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

When you host a server, it is your job, being the owner, to ensure your players safety. If you are looking at their passes, you’re breaking the unspoken agreement between managers and clients. The best thing to do is write something to check for dupes, or to have a file containing an already encrypted password (that you know) and then to get on their account do this:
Copy their hashed password to a blank text file
In the account file, replace the password with the encrypted password that you know
Log into their account with that password
When finished, copy their old password from that text file and put it back onto their account.

If you are really wanting to see the password, chances are you are doing it for a bad reason.

Read full topic
